title: Charlie Puth's 'Voicenotes' is a Solid Effort
summary: The lead single off of the album, “Short Hair,” is a very catchy and fun pop track. The title track, Voicenotes, is “inspired by what [he] went through” and that “the emotions and the feelings” were his inspiration. Puth also teamed up with frequent collaborator Shawn Mendes for a song called “Change My Life” It’s a great collaboration that shows that Puth and Mendes are both on their way to becoming superstars.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Charlie Puth has been on a roll lately, with three top 40 hits in the last two years. He\u2019s also worked with some pretty big names (including one we\u2019ll get to shortly). Now, he\u2019s back with another new album, titled \u201CVoicenotes.\u201D It\u2019s a solid effort that shows growth and maturity, as well as keeping Puth\u2019s fun and lighthearted style.
At its core, Voicenotes is an acoustic pop album. However, it goes deeper than just putting electric guitars aside; these songs are stripped right down to the bare bones. There\u2019s still plenty of production value\u2014especially on the third track\u2014but it feels like Puth made a conscious decision not to hide behind anything.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Bad for Me is a bassy and groovy pop song with a killer chorus and great rhythm, while How Long is more of a ballad with a very Puth-ian piano. Both are a great taste of the album, and they are already off to a great start.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Puth has said that the title track, Voicenotes, is \u201Cinspired by what ","[he]"," went through,\u201D and that \u201Cthe emotions and the feelings\u201D were his inspiration. \u201CIt\u2019s about making a change in your life. You\u2019ve got to change the way you look at things,\u201D and he truly manages to create an uplifting and inspiring track.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Puth also teamed up with frequent collaborator Shawn Mendes for a song called \u201CChange My Life.\u201D It\u2019s a very catchy, bouncy pop song, and it\u2019s one of the strongest tracks on the album."))),mdx("h2",null,"Charlie Puth\u2019s growth as an artist"),mdx("p",null,"Puth has proven that he\u2019s not just a one-hit wonder, and that\u2019s always a good sign. Though he\u2019s stayed in a similar genre, and some of the songs have a similar feel, he\u2019s experimented with new sounds and new styles, while still keeping his sound. There are still strong pop hooks throughout all of these songs, but he\u2019s exploring different textures and different feels. He\u2019s growing as an artist, and it\u2019s a really nice progression to see."),mdx("p",null,"Puth also seems to be growing as a songwriter. These songs are less endearing and more mature than those on his previous two albums. The lyrics of Voicenotes are a bit darker, and they\u2019re more real. You can feel the emotion behind each song, and it feels like Puth has really put himself out there."),mdx("h2",null,"Voice Notes: Title track and lead single"),mdx("p",null,"Voicenotes is the first track on the album, and it is a beautiful and breathy acoustic pop song. Puth\u2019s voice is particularly strong here, and the chorus is an absolute banger. The lyrics are contemplative and are reminiscent of an adult journal or a letter to someone close to the writer. Puth has said that the song is intended to be a love song, and that it was written while he was in a relationship. It\u2019s a very personal song, and it\u2019s a great way to kick off the album."),mdx("p",null,"The lead single off of the album, \u201CShort Hair,\u201D is a very catchy and fun pop track. It\u2019s a bit more upbeat than many of the songs on the album, and it\u2019s a great choice for a lead single. It\u2019s a very lighthearted and fun track that is also very catchy, and it\u2019s a great introduction to Puth\u2019s latest album."),mdx("h2",null,"Nine Track Mind"),mdx("p",null,"\u201CNine Track Mind\u201D is the seventh track off of Voicenotes. The chorus is dreamy and gorgeous, and it is one of my favorite tracks off of the album."),mdx("p",null,"The title and chorus make a play on the \u201C8-track\u201D sound system that was popular in the 70s and 80s, while Puth\u2019s voice and tone are perfect for this laid-back and dreamy track. It\u2019s a very chilled-out song, and it\u2019s a great track to relax to."),mdx("h2",null,"Change My Life (ft. Shawn Mendes)"),mdx("p",null,"\u201CChange My Life\u201D is the 14th track on the album. It is a very catchy, upbeat track, with a light and airy tone. Despite the fact that it has a light tone, the track is very deep and meaningful, with Puth and Mendes singing about finding someone who can save them. It\u2019s a very sweet, meaningful track, and it\u2019s another one of my favorites on the album."),mdx("p",null,"The track is a very strong collaboration, and it\u2019s a great track that shows two artists who are both on their way to becoming superstars. It\u2019s a bit more experimental, and it\u2019s a very different sound from most of the rest of the album. It\u2019s a very different track, and it\u2019s one that I personally love."),mdx("p",null,"It\u2019s another track that feels very real, and it\u2019s a very interesting track that\u2019s worth listening to even if you don\u2019t usually go for this type of music. The chemistry and dynamic between Steinfeld and Puth is really interesting, and this track is a great example of the two of them working together."),mdx("h2",null,"Fool\u2019s Gold"),mdx("p",null,"\u201CFool\u2019s Gold\u201D is the 37th track on the album. It has a bit of a darker tone, but it\u2019s still a very light track, and it\u2019s very easy to listen to."),mdx("p",null,"This is another track that I really like, and it\u2019s a great way to end the album. It has great production and is a very smooth track with some fantastic instrumentation. It\u2019s a very catchy and smooth track, and it\u2019s a great track to end the album with."),mdx("h2",null,"Wrapping up"),mdx("p",null,"At the end of the day, Voicenotes is a very solid album. Voicenotes is an acoustic pop album that is going to be a great addition to any playlist."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "Selma" Is a Powerful and Moving Historical Drama

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"It\u2019s been more than a century since the fight for voting rights was so prominent in American society. Films like \u201CSelma\u201D are necessary to remind viewers of this period in our history and the crucial role that certain people played in ensuring voting rights are protected. Before many others, Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., along with other civil rights leaders, attempted to register African-Americans to vote in Selma, Alabama. It was here where police brutality and attacks on protesters were prevalent and where media attention centered around televised trials of two men accused of murdering local Black residents. The town was also home to Selma\u2019s most famous resident at the time: Collin W. Lewis, also known as \u201Cthe Lion of Selma\u201D \u2013 a prominent civil rights leader who had grown up there after his family fled Greenwood as part of the Great Migration from 1916-1921. In 1965, Lewis recruited Dr. King to come speak at Selma High School about voting rights. It was here where their partnership began and culminated in the historic march across the Edmund Pettus Bridge on March 7th, 1965 \u2013 known today as Bloody Sunday because those marching were violently attacked by law enforcement officers (including tear gas, billy clubs, and bull whips), leaving many injured and 26 hospitalized (Voting Rights Timeline)."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Hip Hop Music with a Purpose: The Importance of Awareness in the Music Industry

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...s}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...s,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The music industry is vast, expansive, and unending. The number of subgenres and variations within the larger genres is innumerable. It\u2019s also an industry that has recently come under fire for its lack of diversity and representation in regards to gender, sexuality, religion, race, and so much more. As a result of these issues becoming more apparent and publicized, artists have been producing music with a purpose; focusing on important topics and causes through their music.
If you spend any time listening to rap or hip-hop music, you\u2019ve probably noticed how many songs are about money, sex, drugs, partying\u2014basically all the things you can do when you\u2019re rich and famous. But there are some rappers who are using their fame to make a difference in the world by speaking out about problems that need to be addressed: social injustice, poverty, drug abuse, child exploitation and other serious issues. These artists are making a conscious effort to use their music to make a positive impact on society rather than just focusing on things like materialism or promiscuity.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "Imitation of Life" Is a Thought-Provoking Drama about Race and Identity
"The Grapes of Wrath" Is a Classic of American Literature
"The Hateful Eight" Is a Quentin Tarantino Tour De Force
Foster the People's 'Sacred Hearts Club' Is a Fun Ride
Haim's 'Something to Tell You' Is a Delightful Pop Album

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`It\u2019s been almost three years since we heard new music from HAIM, the sister trio from Calabasas that burst onto the music scene in 2014 with their debut album \u2018Days Are Gone.\u2019
With their sophomore album, \u2018Something to Tell You,\u2019 HAIM continues to be optimistic and uplifting with their new music. The album is a mix of upbeat pop tracks and slower ballads that showcase the sisters\u2019 harmony and vocals. Even if you aren't a fan of pop music, it's worth giving this album a listen.
The trio had been working on this album for some time before releasing it. In September 2016, they released three singles; \u201CRight Now,\u201D \u201CNew York Excuse\u201D and \u201CSentimentality.\u201D
And after a year-long hiatus following the release of these songs, HAIM announced via Instagram in June 2017 that they would finally be releasing their second studio album (and first extended play) later that year.
Luckily for us, they stuck to their word and released the nine-track EP on Sept. 14, just in time for our listening pleasure. Here are some of our favorite tracks from HAIM's 'Something To Tell You' Album:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Chvrches' 'Love Is Dead' Is a Pop Gem

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In today\u2019s musical landscape, popular electronic music has taken over the pop world. But there are still some great pop albums that aren\u2019t filled with auto-tune and EDM drops.On May 25th, the Scottish band Chvrches released their third album called \u201C Love is Dead.\u201D The synth-pop band has lots of happy vibes and catchy hooks on their new album. It\u2019s a pleasant listen but might not be what you expect if you only know them from their first two albums. The band took a left turn creatively, covering topics like technology, isolation and death rather than dancing around in your bedroom to this record.
Chvrses has gained more popularity among a different group of fans by releasing this album than they ever did with their first two releases combined. This is partially because they have expanded their audience by collaborating on songs with Haim and Bleachers recently as well as making this change in sound so now they have crossover appeal to radio listeners too!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Death Cab for Cutie's 'Thank You for Today' Is a Delight

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Thank You for Today is the sixth album from Seattle indie rockers Death Cab for Cutie. Released on August 31, 2018, it\u2019s also the band\u2019s final record with their original label Atlantic Records. After two decades in the music business, Death Cab for Cutie have developed into one of the most beloved bands in indie rock.
After their last album, Codes and Keys (2012), frontman Ben Gibbard announced that he was working on a solo project called The New Age. It was something he had been thinking about for some time but wasn\u2019t sure when or if it would come to fruition. Fortunately, after meeting with producer Rich Costey (M83, Blond Redhead) who helped him record some demos, things fell into place. The album came out as a collaborative release between Ben Gibbard and Nathan Wiley under the name The Further Adventures of New Age. And three years later Death Cab For Cutie released Thank You For Today.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Bts's 'Love Yourself: Tear' Is a Triumph

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In a world where every band is a boy band, BTS stands out. The Korean sextet has made a name for itself as not just another boy band but one that plays its own instruments and has choreographed dance routines that are so intricate they sometimes require special stage lighting.
Armed with these weapons, BTS has twice cracked the top 10 on the Billboard 200 album chart with its Love Yourself series. And the latest installment of this series \u2014 which doubles as its sixth EP \u2014 is no exception.
Furthermore, it\u2019s the strongest of the bunch.
It\u2019s impossible to talk about BTS without mentioning their massive following beyond Korea: Vivid, obsessive ARMYs (as they call them) who follow their every move and buy everything associated with them. This is why many people assume they are only famous because of social media and pandering ads (which is true). However, anyone who listens to their music will tell you that they deserve all this success. \u201CLove Yourself: Tear\u201D proves it once again.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
